images.copyright: The Trossachs National Park in autumn, Stirling, Scotland (© Jon Arnold/Danita Delimont)
images.title: A poetic landscape
images.caption: Land of lochs and forests
images.desc: Where better to enjoy the changing of the seasons than Loch Lomond and The Trossachs National Park? Here, woodlands made up of millions of Scots pine, oak, larch, rowan and Atlantic oakwood trees offer a refuge for protected species like red deer and golden eagles as well as black grouse, otters and red squirrels. Situated on the southern edge of the Highlands, Scotland’s first national park also offers over 1100 square kilometres of misty mountains, rugged hills, sparkling lochs, rivers and villages.  Loch Lomond itself is Britain’s largest freshwater lake at 44.2 square kilometres.

tooltips.walle: આ છબી વૉલપેપર તરીકે ડાઉનલોડ કરવા માટે ઉપલબ્ધ નથી.
tooltips.walls: આ ઇમેજ ડાઉનલોડ કરો. આ ઇમેજનો ઉપયોગ ફક્ત વૉલપેપર સુધી મર્યાદિત છે.
